Description: Typical range for industrial ns-pulsed fiber lasers at 1064 nm cleaning soft rocks like shale; starting at 200 W balances efficiency and avoids thermal cracking due to shale's low thermal conductivity (~1-2 W/m·K). Max safe before damage ~500 W to prevent substrate ablation. Source: Manufacturer specs (e.g., IPG Photonics YLR series) and studies on laser cleaning of stone (Optics and Lasers in Engineering, 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Shale mineral absorption characteristics
Beam spot diameter for effective Shale cleaning resolution
Optimal repetition rate for continuous Shale surface processing
Nanosecond pulse duration for efficient Shale ablation with minimal heat diffusion
Optimal scanning speed for uniform Shale surface treatment
Recommended number of passes for complete Shale surface cleaning
Optimal beam overlap for uniform Shale surface cleaning
